content: caswell scarf by janet cullen caswell scarf was designed to use up leftover yarns the scarf is fully reversible and may be knitted for as long as desired the scarf is named after the ship that my great great grandfather sailed upon any weight of yarn may be used for this scarf the sample above was made using 6 5 mm/us 10 5 needles and bulky yarn and is 18 cm/7 wide a lighter weight yarn will make a narrower scarf while a heavier yarn will produce a wider scarf use needles that suit your yarn weight e g dk 4 mm/us 6 worsted 4 5 mm/us 7 aran 5 mm/ us 8 bulky 6 5 mm/us 10 5 gauge is not important for this design abbreviations st/s - stitch/es m1 - make one new stitch by picking up the horizontal loop c4b - place next 2 sts on a cable needle and hold at between the needles and knit into the back of it the back work knit the following 2 sts now knit the sts k - knit from the cable needle p - purl k2tog - knit the next 2 sts together pattern instructions final border cast on 26 sts decrease row k4 k2tog k6 repeat to last 4 sts k4 note if you wish to make a wider scarf then cast on knit 7 row more sts in multiples of 7 knit 7 row bind off increase row k4 m1 k7 repeat to last 8 sts k8 weave in loose ends total 28 sts block wear and enjoy main pattern row 1 k4 k4 p4 repeat to last 8 sts k8 row 2 k4 p4 k4 repeat to end of row the copyright of this pattern remains with me janet row 3 k4 c4b p4 repeat to last 8 sts c4b k4 cullen row 4 & 5 as row 2 & 1 above this pattern is available for free from ravelry com you row 6 k4 p4 c4b repeat to last 8 sts p4 k4 may make items for sale using this pattern repeat these 6 row until the scarf is the desired length less the final border end with any row except a please consider giving a donation to p/hop in aid of cable row the standard length for a scarf is for it to medecins sans frontiers/doctors without borders if you be as long as a person is tall have enjoyed this design © janet cullen 2011
